means: 预先安排，预先商定( prearrange的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: This evidence supports their contention that the outbreak of violence was prearranged.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一证据证实了他们的观点，即此次突发暴力事件是有预谋的。

sentence.Network_en: Working to a prearranged plan, he rang the First Secretary and requested an appointment with the Ambassador.
sentence.Network_cn: 按照预先安排的计划，他打电话给一等秘书，请求约见大使。

sentence.Network_en: In dealing with that unpredictable man, you simply cannot follow a prearranged plan, you have to play it by ear.
sentence.Network_cn: 和那个捉摸不定的人打交道, 你简直无法按预定计划行事, 只好随机应变.

I answer with prearranged signals ., 我用事先安排好的手势作答.

run to your positionswhen you hear the prearranged signal .你们听到预定的信号时，就各就各位。

entry.tran: 预先安排的；提前准备的
entry.def: You use prearranged to indicate that something has been planned or arranged before the time when it actually happens.

example.ex: Working to a prearranged plan, he rang the First Secretary and requested an appointment with the Ambassador.
example.tran: 按照预先安排的计划，他打电话给一等秘书，请求约见大使。

auth_sentence.content: People who are happy they've prearranged their funerals.
auth_sentence.res_content: People who are happy they've prearranged their funerals.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People who are happy they've prearranged their funerals.

auth_sentence.content: High chairs, pushchairs and cots can all be prearranged.
auth_sentence.res_content: High chairs, pushchairs and cots can all be prearranged.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: High chairs, pushchairs and cots can all be prearranged.

auth_sentence.content: She...gave the prearranged knock on the door.
auth_sentence.res_content: She...gave the prearranged knock on the door.
